title: Design comprehensive template syntax and features
description: Design the full template syntax including expressions, control flow, filters, partials, and other advanced features beyond basic variable interpolation.
design:
Complete template syntax design summary:

EXPRESSIONS & OPERATIONS:
- Math: +, -, *, /, % ✅
- Strings: .. concatenation ✅
- Arrays/Tables: items[1], user.key ✅
- Function calls: math.floor(), etc. ✅
- Safe navigation: ?. operator ✅
- Logic/comparison: Not needed (display booleans) ❌

CONTROL FLOW:
- {% if/elseif/else %} ... {% endif %} ✅
- {% for var in iterable %} ... {% endfor %} ✅
- Lua-like syntax with explicit endif/endfor ✅
- No while loops, no variable assignment ❌

FILTERS & MODIFIERS:
- Pipeline operator |> instead of | ✅
- {{ value |> filter(args) }} → filter(value, args)
- No parens for no-arg: {{ name |> uppercase }} ✅
- Multiple chaining supported ✅

COMMENTS:
- {-- comment --} for single/multi-line ✅
- Lua-like -- syntax ✅
- Completely ignored, no output ✅

ADVANCED VARIABLE ACCESS:
- Dynamic property access: user[dynamic_key] ✅
- Extends expression parsing ✅

WHITESPACE CONTROL:
- {{- trims before, -}} trims after ✅
- {{- expr -}} trims both sides ✅
- Explicit control for clean output ✅

PARTIALS: Skipped, using components instead ✅

REMAINING: Helpers, Template Inheritance, Macros

title: Design template component system
description: Design the component-based template system that will make templates easy for AI to create and compose. Define component structure, registration, and usage patterns.

title: Design template component system
description: Design the component-based template system that will make templates easy for AI to create and compose. Define component structure, registration, and usage patterns.
design:
Component-based template system design decisions:
- Components use Capital naming (Button, not button) to distinguish from HTML elements
- XML-style syntax: <Button class=\"primary\" text=\"Save\"/>
- Components inlined during compilation (no function call overhead)
- Template string registration API
- Top-level templates compile to single functions with everything inlined
- Self-closing syntax: <Button/> for simple components, <Button></Button> for content
- Compilation: Components become inline string concatenation in final function
- ERROR SEMANTICS: Compile-time validation of component names with clear error messages
- Validation: Registry lookup during compilation, suggests corrections for typos
acceptance_criteria: Design document completed with syntax specification
